topics.author: 5446fcfc6368723ec21a0000

topics.body:
You know; as much of a asshole I am I think I might be too nice.

My mom's laptop broke and I gave her my laptop.  She doesn't necessarily "need" it but I figured that it would save her $500 to replace it.  Even though it was a older laptop it was still worth around $150 based upon the specs.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5577b1b06368725e77002ceb#post_5577b1b06368725e77002ceb
That's pretty normal.
I gave up my phone to my mom when she broke hers. 

One time, my parents' bed broke so I sleep on the couch so that my parents' could sleep in my room. They were fine with sleeping on the floor with a thick blanket like the Japanese do but I gave them my bed.

People would do a whole lot for their parents.
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5577b1b06368725e77002ceb#post_5577b1b06368725e77002ceb
My mom broke MY laptop and was utterly convinced I was gonna be mad about it. I mean I couldn't be too mad considering it was an accident and the fact that she's my mom.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5577b2c46368725e77002e48#post_5577b2c46368725e77002e48
I'd die for my mom. I'm not even joking about that. I know she'd probably punch me if she knew I said that, but it's the truth.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5577b3766368723f5f000ad7#post_5577b3766368723f5f000ad7
I remember you telling that story. 
You told us that you tried to calm down your mom who was utterly convinced that you were mad.

I thought it was pretty funny.

My mom is kind of a cool guy when she isn't being a complete lunatic.
I mean really, what kind of mother tazes her son for a laugh?
